description: This Java source file defines the IPCReceiver class, which implements a server component for inter-process communication (IPC). It sets up a socket, listens for incoming IPC requests, and delegates request handling to a specified handler. It supports starting, shutting down, and processing requests asynchronously.

classes.name: IPCReceiver
classes.description: Worker class that manages listening for IPC requests over a socket, delegating processing to a handler, and managing its lifecycle.

classes.name: IPCReceiver.Request
classes.description: Inner class that handles individual incoming IPC request connections, decoding messages, handling pings, and sending replies.

methods.name: IPCReceiver
methods.description: Constructor that initializes the server to listen on the specified port.

methods.name: getPortNumber
methods.description: Returns the port number on which the server is listening.

methods.name: getHandler
methods.description: Returns the current request handler assigned to this receiver.

methods.name: startReceiveThread
methods.description: Begins listening for incoming IPC requests on a new thread, using the specified handler.

methods.name: shutdown
methods.description: Stops the server socket and thread pool, effectively shutting down the receiver.

methods.name: execute
methods.description: Main task loop waiting for incoming socket connections and spawning request handlers.
